OBS.-This genus is founded on a remarkable and rare Fern, first described by Willdenow in 1810, from specimens collected in Venezuela by Humboldt and Bonpland. At the time of the publication of Hooker and Bauer’s “ Genera Filicum ’' I had not seen specimens of this Fern‚ and there· fore followed Presl in retaining it in Pterideae ‚· having subsequenssy received specimens‚ I find iius nabural asso- ciation bo be with Dmomenea Dictyoptevia and Aspidium, especially such as A. macrophylbum‚ with which it agrees in habit and venation, but differs from Aspidium in having the sporangia produced close to the margin, and forming an apparent linear sorus parallel with the margin which is inflexed in the form of a narrow membraneous indusium, which circumstance led authors to refer it fo Pteris.
